Report.get_full_report: Get the full report of Performance, Accessibility, Best Practices:

ReportDetails.http_status_code: The HTTP Status Code is a server response indicating the status of a request. A 200 status means the request was successful, while codes like 404 or 500 indicate errors.
ReportDetails.meta_charset: The Meta Charset tag specifies the character encoding for the HTML document. UTF-8 is the most widely used and recommended encoding.
ReportDetails.meta_viewport: The Meta Viewport tag controls the layout on mobile devices, ensuring your website is responsive and properly scaled across different screen sizes.
ReportDetails.link_canonical: The Canonical Link tag tells search engines the preferred URL of a web page, helping to avoid duplicate content issues.
ReportDetails.document_title: The Document Title is the title of the web page displayed in the browser tab and in search engine results. It should be concise and descriptive.
ReportDetails.meta_description: The Meta Description tag provides a brief summary of the page content, often displayed in search engine results below the title.
ReportDetails.link_text: Link Text is the clickable text in a hyperlink. It should be descriptive and relevant to the linked content for better accessibility and SEO.
ReportDetails.is_crawlable: Determines whether a webpage is accessible to search engine crawlers. A crawlable page can be indexed and ranked in search results.
ReportDetails.hreflang_tags: hreflang Tags indicate the language and regional targeting of a webpage, helping search engines serve the correct version of the page to users.
ReportDetails.crawlable_anchors: Crawlable Anchors refer to links on a page that search engines can follow. Ensuring anchors are crawlable improves site navigation and SEO.
ReportDetails.image_alt: The Image Alt attribute provides a text description of an image, which helps search engines understand the content and improves accessibility for visually impaired users.
ReportDetails.open_graph: Open Graph tags define how your content appears when shared on social media platforms, including the title, description, and image.
ReportDetails.twitter_card: Twitter Card tags allow you to control how your web page is displayed when shared on Twitter, including a summary, large image, or video.
